comment: Very easy class. Professor Grover is very nice and seems passionate.  Workload wasn't too demanding and everything is in the syllabus. Pop quizzes based on reading. Professor Grover's lectures can get very boring sometimes and the exam questions can be confusing. Not too bad, came out with an A. & the final is optional!

I love this professor! He is so amazing and makes psychology interesting and fun. He is very clear on what will be on the quizzes and tests. He provides the class with detailed study guides every test. I would recommend this professor to anyone!

I was mad I had to take this class, as I wasn't new to the college experience, but it ended up not being so bad. Prof Grover is extremely patient and helpful if you have any questions or concerns. Class overall is VERY easy. Just some reading and group activities and that's about it. Show up and participate and you'll do VERY well.

Prof very proficient in explaining what you need to know on the Regent's.  Always helpful if you ask.  If you don't ask, he will.  He wants you to succeed and pass the Reading portion of the Regent's.  I learned alot from him in how to read with alot more understanding.

Extremely easy class.  Professor Grover is a funny and excellent professor.   He is a little scrambled sometimes but he makes jokes on himself about it.  This class however is a waste of money though for those of us that are non-traditional students... should not be mandatory for that group of students.

Amazing Lecturer ! ! ! !  It certainly made my life a litter easier.  Wonderful Professor, he even treated the entire class to ice cream.  I enjoyed his class because he made me smile and laugh alot!!!!!
My sentiments exactly. Unfair, lots of busy work. Confusing tests. DO NOT TAKE this class if you want to keep your GPA up.
very sneaky about assignment giving. everything is on sylabus and he expects u to basically have that thing memorized

The cutest old man ever. He rambles on about his own life in his lectures but it's KSU 1101, and we all know no one needs that class. If you miss less than 3 classes he will bump you grade up if you need it. Easy tests, just skim through the book. He cancels class a lot for individual meetings with students.

Really nice guy, cares about his students but still will never remember your name. His tests may be worded confusing at times, but if you tell him why you misunderstood the question and its a legitimate reason, he will give you the points.

This was a very easy class yes there is a lot of work, but it is easy to do and you get full credit for it.  There are 2 test and optional final.If you miss a test, which I did you can take final. I made a 0 on that test and thought I would have to take the final,but I had an A in the class even with a 0. This should prove that it is an easy class.

Oh god. I took this guy for ksu 1101 my freshman year. he assigns wayyy to much work and is slightly annoying. Not really a big help when you need it. Requires much much more than other teachers. Ten hours of volunteer work required, and the class is boring. He's a nice man but I would not advise you to take him if your a freshman.

DO NOT TAKE HIM! WORST TEACHER AT KSU! VERY HARD & CONFUSING! I graduated high school with a 4.0 and never made lower than a B ever. Nothing he goes over in class is on the test. Test questions are worded so confusing theres no way to know the correct answer. Attendance is mandantory! I made my first C ever because of this ridiculous old man!
No Comments

i thought this class was insanely easy. the workload isn't too much and every due date is set within the syllabus. the only reason to attend class is that at least one assignment is due each class. you don't really need to read any of the books as long as you are good at remembering the basic points of each one, which he goes over in class.

grover was so bad some kids from my class came on here to write good reviews just so more people would take his awful class. i have never in my life been so angry than when i was in his class. he is extremely unintelligent and contradictory. his tests conssit of questions about his pets and marriage, and he gives more assignments than major classes

Easy class. If you made it to college, you probably know the material. Relies heavily on "7 Habits of Teens". Tests worded confusingly. Many pop quizzes. Sometimes boring. Good professor considering the material.

The KSU classes were the worst things ever invented, he can't help that.  The content is boring and useless, but you have to take the class anyways.  He's a pretty cool guy all in all.  I don't see how you couldn't get an 'A' in this class.

This teacher is amazing! Those students who believe his classes are hard are usually freshman who believe all college classes are hard. His homework is based on whether or not you make an effort. Basically, if you turn your assignments in on time, you get all the points. He's willing to listen to your opinions about his tests.

nice guy, very understanding about late assignments. the curriculum for the class is horrible, he assigns A LOT of work, does not give study guides for tests, and the test questions all have unclear answers. most class time is just talking about the books we are supposed to read, he doesn't really give a lot of notes. nice guy, but bad class.

This class was really horrible.  I found the professor to not give study guides before tests, hence most people failed them.  Our class always argued with him because of his lack of clarity in assignments.  He constantly referred to the syllabus which was very poorly written.  I highley recommend you don't take this class if you can help it.
do the work get an a
He was really nice and all the work was easy.  BUT for an easy A, which it is, its a lot of work.
Everything is graded for completion. Just turn in the work and you will get an A
